DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Hot Flashes Therapeutic Procedure Stratification Factors Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of prior hot flash therapeutic procedures the patient has had as a stratification factor for participation on a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Hot Flashes Therapeutic Procedure Stratification Factors
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Earlier in time or order._A temporary feeling of intense body warmth, flushing, sometimes accompanied by sweating. A common, symptom of menopause; other conditions that can produce hot flushes include antidepressants and drugs blocking the effect of estrogens, carcinoid tumors and a sensitivity to sulfites or other food additives._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Hot Flashes Therapeutic Procedure Stratification Factors
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A sudden, temporary onset of body warmth, flushing, and sweating (often associated with menopause).:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

Concepts.definition: A temporary feeling of intense body warmth, flushing, sometimes accompanied by sweating. A common, symptom of menopause; other conditions that can produce hot flushes include antidepressants and drugs blocking the effect of estrogens, carcinoid tumors and a sensitivity to sulfites or other food additives.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/3/2021: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredName: Prior Hot Flashes Therapeutic Procedure Stratification Factors Count
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number of prior hot flash therapeutic procedures.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than or Equal To One

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To One
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mathematical element that when added to another number yields the same number; the cardinal number meaning one less than one.

Concepts.definition: A mathematical element that when added to another number yields the same number; the cardinal number meaning one less than one.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
